Beginning Tuesday, each of our elementary schools will begin using a new security feature for parents, guardians and guests needing to access the school building after school hours. This new system requires visitors to use the video door bell that is on the wall near the main entrance. This means the front door of the building will be locked at 2:45 p.m. and anyone arriving on campus who needs to go inside will be required to use the door bell. This new system is in addition to the current check-in and check-out procedures that require a photo ID to be presented to the main office.

Again, beginning on Tuesday all elementary schools will be using a video door bell system to access the building after school hours.

Have a great week!

We are happy to report the email gremlins have been defeated! After working very closely with Microsoft support, the district‚Äôs email system was restored to full functionality around 6:15 p.m.

With the help of a Microsoft engineer from Charlotte, it was determined the problem that has plagued us the past 30 hours resulted from an old admin account that was compromised; the bad guys built other accounts in order to spray out spam. The sheer amount of spam triggered Microsoft to shut down our domain. The engineer helped us close some loopholes that blocked this activity for now and the future.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Beginning late in the afternoon on Thursday, November 14, e-mails sent from anyone in our district to external addresses (i.e. anyone without a @rhmail.org address) began to be blocked by Microsoft for an unknown reason.

As of 1:15 p.m. today, November 15, the email delivery issue to external emails is still not working properly. We share this information with you in the event you have sent email to your child's teacher or other district employees in the last 24 hours.
